info.title: FOTA API
info.description:
## Disclaimer regarding undocumented fields
This API documentation describes the officially supported fields and endpoints. However, the API may also include fields that are not explicitly documented.
These undocumented fields are considered internal and may change or be removed at any time without prior notification.
Users who rely on undocumented fields acknowledge and accept the associated risks.

## Account
In order to use FOTA system You must be invited by an existing user.
 If You are a new customer, please contact our sales or support in order to obtain a new company and user account.

Once You can login to <https://fota.teltonika.lt> You shall be able to create API tokens for access to this API.

## Authorization
FOTA API uses Bearer token Authorization header. Each API request should include this header:
- Key: Authorization
- Value: Bearer \<Your API token\>

## Throttling
All HTTP API requests will be throttled if used frequently in order to reduce misuse and the load on our servers.
 We think that 100 request per minute should be enough for most.
 Should You need to control a large amount of resources at once, we recommend using endpoints like 'bulkUpdate', 'bulkCreate' or similar.

## User-Agent
We require all API requests to have User-Agent header containing company, application name and version.
 We are monitoring our API performance and this header helps us to detect, trace and map Your application behaviour and our API performance.
 Failing to include user agent information may result permanent related user/or company removal from the system.

## Content headers
Most of the requests (except file uploads or downloads) must have headers defining JSON content type of the transaction.
 Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json

## Bulk actions
Some requests are executed in asynchronous manner. These requests in their response body return **background_action_id** that
 can be used to access background action information using *GET /backgroundActions/{backgroundActionId}*.
        
### Active bulk actions limit
A further limitation to bulk actions is imposed to prevent queueing too many at the same time.
 It is based on the number of active (pending or executing) actions.
 Maximum of **4 active bulk actions** are allowed at the same time per API user. HTTP *429 Too Many Requests* code is returned when the limit is reached.
 Bulk action responses include background action ID which can be passed to background actions endpoint to check status of the action.

## Tri-Source
Bulk endpoints accepts tri-source request in JSON format.
You have to to send **source** property with value id_list or filter.

Also you have to send **id_list** or **filter** property according to what you sending in source.

And finally you have to send **data** property with wanted data.

## Date-Time fields
All date-time type fields in API responses are in UTC and formatted as 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss'.

## More information
Full documentation regarding FOTA system can be found here [Teltonika WIKI](https://wiki.teltonika-gps.com/view/FOTA_WEB).
API get started, changelog and additional information can be found here [FOTA WEB Getting started API](https://wiki.teltonika-gps.com/view/FOTA_WEB_Getting_Started_API).

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Possible values: asc, desc. Default: asc

example.message: Retry failed tasks job was created

post.summary: Merge one company with all relationships to its parent company
post.description:
**Required Permissions:** `Company.Merge`

Body Parameters

**source** (integer) - Source company ID with resources.

**target** (integer) - Company ID where to merge to - must be ID of the source's parent company.

example.message: Company merge job was created. It will be merged shortly.

post.description:
**Required Permissions:** `Company.Delete`

Body parameters

**source** (string) - Type of bulk job source (id_list or filter).

**id_list** (array) - optional Id list of resources to be affected.

**filter** (array) - optional JSON with filters to affect only specific resources. Possible values are described in `CompanyFilter` schema.

example.message: Bulk delete job was created. Companies will be removed shortly.

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Filter companies by parent company ids

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search companies by id, name or code

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Possible values: id, name, code, company_name, created_by, created_at

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Possible values: asc, desc. Default: asc

post.description:
**Required Permissions:** `Company.Create`

Body Parameters

**name** (string) - Name of the Company.

**company_id** (integer) - ID of the parent company. This can be Your company ID or ID of one of the companies You control.

put.description:
**Required Permissions:** `Company.Update`

Body Parameters

**name** (string) - optional Name of the Company.

**company_id** (string) - optional ID of the parent company. This can be Your company ID or ID of one of Your controlled companies.

patch.description:
**Required Permissions:** `Company.Update`

Body Parameters

**name** (string) - optional Name of the Company.

**company_id** (string) - optional ID of the parent company. This can be Your company ID or ID of one of Your controlled companies.

delete.description:
**Required Permissions:** `Company.Delete`

Companies cannot be deleted if they have files, devices, groups or users assigned to them.

post.summary: Export information of devices to a file
post.description:
**Required Permissions:** `Device.Export`

Body Parameters

**source** (string) - Type of bulk job source (id_list or filter).

**id_list** (array) optional - Id list of resources to be affected.

**filter** (array) optional - JSON with filters to affect only specific resources. Possible values are described in `DeviceFilter` schema.

**format** (string) - csv or xlsx file.

**columns** (array) - columns to be exported.

Possible values: imei, serial, activity_status, task_queue, model, current_configuration, current_firmware,
description, seen_at, created_at, updated_at, gsm_number, iccid, imsi, company_name, group_name, model_platform

**description** (string) optional - export file description.

example.message: File will be created shortly. Check files in a second.

get.summary: Get statistics for a specific property across devices

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Property name for the statistics report. Possible values: activity_status, created_at_date, current_configuration, current_firmware, first_login_at_date, model

parameters.name: task_queue
parameters.description: Filter devices by task queue statuses

parameters.description: Search devices by imei, serial or description

get.summary: Get all distinct values for a filter

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Field name to retrieve distinct values of. Possible values: company_id, group_id, model, current_firmware, current_configuration, activity_status, task_queue, model_platform

post.description:
**Required Permissions:** `Device.Update`

Body Parameters

**data** - Data to be updated.

**data.company_id** (integer) optional - Company ID if You would like to move devices to another company

**data.group_id** (integer) optional - Group ID if You would like to move devices to another group

**data.description** (string) optional - Device description.

**source** (string) - Type of bulk job source (id_list or filter).

**id_list** (array) optional - Id list of resources to be affected.

**filter** (array) optional - JSON with filters to affect only specific resources. Possible values are described in `DeviceFilter` schema.

example.message: Bulk update job was created. Devices will be updated shortly.

post.description:
**Required Permissions:** `File.Create`

Body Parameters

**company_ids** (array) - Company Id array.

**type** (string) - File type.

Possible file types: firmware, configuration, certificate, blue_nrg, ble_fw.

**file** (file) - File to be uploaded.

**description** (string) optional - File description.

example.message: Bulk delete job was created. Roles will be removed shortly.

get.summary: Get all distinct values for a filter

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Field name to retrieve distinct values of. Possible values: company_id, status_id, created_by, type, group_id, model, current_firmware, current_configuration

parameters.name: device_imei
parameters.description: Filter tasks by device imei numbers

post.description:
**Required Permissions:** `Task.Create`

**source** (string) - Type of bulk job source (`id_list` or `filter`). Check examples of how to use each source.

Possible filter values when using "filter" source are described in `TaskFilter` schema.

Some task types require additional information, file or attributes. Check examples of each task type.

**data.expire_existing_tasks** (bool) optional - If `true`, expire all pending tasks of same task type. If not set, defaults to `false`.

**data.schedule** is only available for `Standard` and `Premium` level clients. Check example on how to use.

Source: Filter.description: The same device filters are available as in `GET /devices` endpoint.

Task Type: Upload user TLS certificate.summary: Task Type: Upload user TLS certificate

Task Type: Upload CAN OEM file.summary: Task Type: Upload CAN OEM file
Task Type: Upload CAN OEM file.description: Available `vehicle_id` values are returned by `GET /canAdapters/vehicles` endpoint.

Task Type: Upload CAN adapter firmware.summary: Task Type: Upload CAN adapter firmware
Task Type: Upload CAN adapter firmware.description: Newest available firmware for each device will be selected during task execution.

Task Type: Upload FMXY50 CAN chip firmwa.summary: Task Type: Upload FMXY50 CAN chip firmware

Task Type: Receive internal log.description:
Required attributes:
- `order` - log files download order. Value options: `newest`, `oldest`.
- `count` - amount of log files to download. Value must be between 1 and 10.

Task Schedule.description:
***Note:*** Tasks scheduling is only available for `Standard` and `Premium` level clients.

Only `specific_hours` type is supported. Required attributes: - `from_minutes` - schedule start time in minutes starting from 00:00 UTC. Value must be between 0 and 1440. - `duration_minutes` - schedule duration in minutes. Value must be between 120 and 1440.

example.message: Bulk task create job was created. Tasks will be created shortly.

post.description:
**Required Permissions:** `Task.Update`

Body Parameters

**source** (string) - Type of bulk job source (id_list or filter).

**id_list** (array) optional - tasks id list to be affected.

**filter** (array) optional - JSON with filters to affect only specific resources. Possible values are described in `TaskFilter` schema.

example.message: Bulk task cancel job was created. Tasks will be cancelled shortly.

parameters.name: status_id
parameters.description: Filter tasks by task status ids

parameters.name: device_imei
parameters.description: Filter tasks by device imei numbers

parameters.name: created_by
parameters.description: Filter tasks by creator user ids

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Filter tasks by device group ids

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Filter tasks by device model names

parameters.name: current_firmware
parameters.description: Filter tasks by device firmware versions

parameters.name: current_configuration
parameters.description: Filter tasks by device configuration filenames

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Possible values: id, device_imei, type, company_name, created_at, created_by, status_changed_at

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Possible values: asc, desc. Default: asc

post.description:
**Required Permissions:** `Task.Create`

Some task types require additional information, file or attributes. Check examples of each task type.

**data.expire_existing_tasks** (bool) optional - If `true`, expire all pending tasks of same task type. If not set, defaults to `false`.

**data.schedule** is only available for `Standard` and `Premium` level clients. Check example on how to use.

Task Type: Upload user TLS certificate.summary: Task Type: Upload user TLS certificate

Task Type: Upload CAN OEM file.summary: Task Type: Upload CAN OEM file
Task Type: Upload CAN OEM file.description: Available `vehicle_id` values are returned by `GET /canAdapters/vehicles` endpoint.

Task Type: Upload CAN adapter firmware.summary: Task Type: Upload CAN adapter firmware
Task Type: Upload CAN adapter firmware.description: Newest available firmware for each device will be selected during task execution.

Task Type: Upload FMXY50 CAN chip firmwa.summary: Task Type: Upload FMXY50 CAN chip firmware

Task Type: Receive internal log.description:
Required attributes:
- `order` - log files download order. Value options: `newest`, `oldest`.
- `count` - amount of log files to download. Value must be between 1 and 10.

Task Schedule.description:
***Note:*** Tasks scheduling is only available for `Standard` and `Premium` level clients.

Only `specific_hours` type is supported. Required attributes: - `from_minutes` - schedule start time in minutes starting from 00:00 UTC. Value must be between 0 and 1440. - `duration_minutes` - schedule duration in minutes. Value must be between 120 and 1440.

parameters.description: Possible values: asc, desc. Default: asc

Body Parameters

Body parameters

**source** (string) - Type of bulk job source (id_list or filter).

**id_list** (array) - optional Id list of resources to be affected.

**filter** (array) - optional JSON with filters to affect only specific resources. Possible values are described in `UserFilter` schema.

example.message: Bulk delete job was created. Users will be removed shortly.
